Class DefaultCoder

java.lang.Object
  net.java.jddac.common.fblock.Entity

All Implemented Interfaces:
ConfigurationInterface, CoderInterface, SubscriberCallback
public class DefaultCoder
extends FunctionBlock
implements CoderInterface

A Coder block that can be configured for different encoding methods.

detectCoding

protected java.lang.String detectCoding(CoderBuffer cb)

encode

public void encode(CoderBuffer cb)
            throws java.lang.Exception
Description copied from interface: CoderInterface
Encodes the message list into JDDAC Arg Xml. The message list in the CoderBuffer is encoded into JDDAC Arg XML and returned in the CoderBuffer byte buffer. The outermost ArgArray tag has its n tag set to the dest parameter.

Specified by:
encode in interface CoderInterface
Parameters:
cb - - CoderBuffer containing message list. XML is returned in its byte buffer.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - on encoding error.

decode

public void decode(CoderBuffer cb)
            throws java.lang.Exception
Description copied from interface: CoderInterface
Decodes the JDDAC Arg Xml into a message list. The XML contained in the byte buffer of the CoderBuffer is decoded into a message list and returned in the CoderBuffer message list.

Specified by:
decode in interface CoderInterface
Parameters:
cb - - CoderBuffer containing the XML. Contains the returned message list.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - on encoding error.

configure

public void configure(ArgArray configuration)
               throws java.lang.Exception
Generic configure Interface.
Name Default Description
DefaultCoder.defaultContentEncoding mp,wbxml Default content encoding.
DefaultCoder.coders   ArgArray of byte coders.
The element name is the coding name used in the defaultContentEncoding configuration value and the element value is the classname of ByteCoder to handle the coding.

Specified by:
configure in interface ConfigurationInterface
Overrides:
configure in class FunctionBlock
Parameters:
configuration - - incoming configuration parameters
Throws:
java.lang.Exception
See Also:
ConfigurationInterface.configure(net.java.jddac.common.type.ArgArray)

public java.lang.String getDefByteCodings()
Gets the defaultContentEncoding configuration parameter.

Returns:
the default content encoding.
